alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 11:55AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL IRON COUNTIES... At 1153 AM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 10 miles east of New Harmony to 12 miles north of Dameron Valley...and moving east at 15 mph. Locations impacted include... Cedar City, Zion National Park, Enoch, New Harmony, Kanarraville, Hamilton Fort, Pintura and Kolob Canyon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 31 and 65. Utah Route 56 between mile markers 43 and 61. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this squall. * sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this squall. Sharply colder temperatures following the snow will cause any water or sluch to quickly freeze on roads and sidewalks. Untreated road surfaces will become extremely slippery and offer little or no traction. Reduced speeds and distance between vehicles is advised. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
